item.title: Litter on Tabard street, 13th January
item.description:
There is a christmas tree, plastic bottles, food packaging, paper and cupboard cups on the on the planters and on the pavement on Tabard Street

item.title: Damaged manhole in parking and bin area, 13th January
item.description:
Its broken and damaged manhole and has become a hazzard to all of us residents at smiles place. please come fix it asap. thank you.

item.title: Uneven road surface +, 13th January
item.description:
The left hand lane - Oakleigh Road North/T-junction with A1000 - has a sunken stretch of road surface plus, due to highways neglect/recent adverse weather conditions, a pothole. This area has been left unchecked for over a year, and is getting worse by the day. Urgent work is now required to correct the condition of this surface area ASAP!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Oakleigh Road North, Whetstone, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Uncollected bin bag, 13th January
item.description:
I put out a black bag of polystyrene last night for black top bin collection today and when the first binman came to move the black top bin towards the road ready for collection he took the black bag off the top of the bin and put it around the corner of the wall and left it there, the other bin men, they came they took the black top bin and emptied it but they left it on the pavement around the corner, I came home after being out all day and found it squashed and lying across the street, I have CCTV of the first bin man taking it off the top of the black top bin and putting it round the corner part of the wall. It was in a black bag because there was no more room in my bin and didn't want It flying down the street though the night It was super light in weight so I don't understand the problem, I did my part by putting out my rubbish in the right bins and put it out ready for collection neatly and sensibly like every one else. I states online that polystyrene is non recyclable and gose with general waste, so why did they leave it behind?

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Eltham Hill, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large pothole pprox 2ft square on Chislehurst Rd just past Sherborne Rd on the left going towards Orpington, 13th January
item.description:

item.title: Bottom of Murray Mews near Murray St vorner, 13th January
item.description:
As you can see on the photos, the metal gate is left open (it doesn’t shut) and blocking pavement, sometimes opens out to the road. Murray Mews’s neighbours have put rope to close it but the residents who live in the building always leave open. Please tell the owner of the building (there are a few flats in the building) to fix the gate so it would close properly and residents to close it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Murray Mews, Kentish Town, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
